title: Godskitchen "techno" font
content:
This W is quite easy to recognize, but had no luck so far. Anyone?   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925080716im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/83/25970.jpg)

 [‹ (x) Ketel One font - Bradley {Justin}](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925080716/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3033 "Go to previous forum topic") [(x) What is Burlesque? - Fabulous {BJ Harvey} ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925080716/http:/www.typophile.com/node/3027 "Go to next forum topic")
author: adriano

comments.content:
Adriano,   
   
The w looks like T-26 [Euphoric](http://web.archive.org/web/20080925080716/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/t26/euphoric/), but many letters look quite different. I haven't seen anything that matches all of these letters. Can we suspect a 'manufactured' or mixed font?

There is a small foundry which always comes to mind for modular   
techno fonts like these. I always forget to bookmark it and now have   
forgotten the name.   
   
Perhaps somebody will recognize it from a description. It's done, as   
I recall, entirely in black and white. The fonts are organized by year,   
with all of the fonts for a chosen year loading (too slowly) in small   
flash samples stacked one above the other toward the right side of   
the page. Some free fonts, mostly pay fonts.   
   
Ring any bells?
Yes! Thanks Mike. I've got it bookmarked now.
yes, buro d. has some fanct techno fonts. But nothing like this.
Smells of Apostrophic Lab or Larabie Fonts.
